children.value: The built-in nodes in G6 include circle, rect, ellipse, diamond, triangle, star, image, and modelRect.

In this document, we will briefly introduce the built-in nodes in G6, the common property, and the way to configure the node type. To knwon more about each type of built-in nodes in G6, please refer to the corresponding documents in this directory.
The table below shows the built-in nodes and their special properties:
is a number representing the diameter
- The circle is centered at the node position
- The label is placed on the center of the circle by default
- The rect in centered at the node position
- The label is placed on the center of the circle by default
is an array, representing the lengths of major diameter and minor diameter
- The ellipse is centered at the node position
- The label is placed on the center of the circle by default
is an array, representing the width and height of the diamond
- The diamond is centered on the node position
- The label is placed on the center of the circle by default
is an array, representing the length of the base and the height of the triangle
- The triangle is centered on the node position
- he label lays on the bottom of the node by default
is a number, representing the size of the star
- The star is centered on the node position
- The label is placed on the center of the circle by default
is an array, representing the width and the height of the image
- The image is centered on the node position
The url of the image. It can be assigned in
- The label lays on the bottom of the node by default
is an array, representing the width and the height of the card
- The modelRect is centered on the node position
- The label is placed on the center of the circle by default
exists, it will lay below the label
The interactions of the node and related edges. It can be null.
represents the anchor on the left top;
represents the anchor ont he right bottom
The label text of the node
is an object to configure the filling color, stroke color, shadow, and so on. Here is the commonly used properties in
The line width of the stroke
The x offset of the shadow
The y offset of the shadow
The alpha or transparency of the node
The filling alpha or transparency of the node
The type of the mouse when hovering the node. The options are the same as
is a string which indicates the content of the label.
is an object to configure the label. The commonly used configurations of
The relative positions to the node. Options:

The following code shows how to configure
There are three methods to configure nodes: Configure nodes globally when instantiating a Graph; Configure nodes in their data; Configure nodes by
That means, if there are same configurations in different ways, the way with higher priority will take effect.

properties.ariaLabel: configure globally when instantiating graph permalink

children.value: to configure all the nodes globally:
// Other properties for all the nodes
To configure different nodes with different properties, you can write the properties into their data individually:
By this way, we can configure different nodes with different properties.
. It does not take effect otherwise;
It has the highest priority that will rewrite the same properties configured by other ways;
Each node will be updated when adding or updating items. It will cost a lot when the amount of the data is large.
The label of the triangle and image node are layed on the bottom, and the others are layed on the center by default.
By writing the properties into the data, we adjust the label position, color, and styles of the node with
as its id. Replace the following code to the code about
Then, we add some description for the node with

{
  id: 'node-modelRect',
  x: 900,
  y: 100,
  description: '描述文本xxxxxxxxxxx',
  shape: 'modelRect',
  label: 'modelRect'
}
—— Change the styles during the interaction process.
